benchmark_details.name: MQ UAKE (Multi-hop Question Answering for Knowledge Editing)
benchmark_details.overview: MQ UAKE comprises multi-hop questions that assess whether edited models correctly answer questions where the answer should change as an entailed consequence of edited facts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate knowledge editing methods for language models via multi-hop questions.

data.source: Constructed from Wikidata and includes user-generated questions via prompts to ChatGPT.
data.size: 9,218 multi-hop questions for MQ UAKE-CF; 1,868 instances for MQ UAKE-T
data.annotation: Manually selected fact chains and generated questions via ChatGPT.

methodology.calculation: Calculates the success of knowledge edits based on how many facts can be recalled and how many multi-hop questions can be answered correctly.
methodology.interpretation: The ability of the edited model to use newly injected knowledge correctly in answers to multi-hop questions.
methodology.validation: Tested against various state-of-the-art knowledge editing approaches.
